specie.description: The native range of this species is SW Alps. It is a bulbous geophyte and grows primarily in the temperate biome.

description: While exploring the Parc naturel régional du Luberon in France, I was fortunate enough to stumble upon a stunning specimen of Lilium pomponium. The plant had a tall, slender stem with a cluster of small, bell-shaped flowers at the top, each about 3 centimeters in diameter. The flowers had a deep, rich red color with dark purple spots that added a striking contrast.

specie.description: The native range of this species is W. Central Tropical Africa to Angola. It is a climber and grows primarily in the wet tropical biome. Has common names and is grown in various countries across Africa, including: Cameroon (okok), Central African Republic, Congo and Angola (KoKo), Nigeria (okazi or afang), Gabon (Nkumu) and the Democratic Republic of Congo (fumbua).

description: During my exploration of the lush tropical rainforests of Central Africa, I was thrilled to come across a stunning example of Gnetum africanum. This impressive plant was a vine with thick, woody stems and glossy, dark green leaves that were oval-shaped and up to 15 cm in length. The leaves had a unique and delicious taste, and were highly valued as a source of vegetable protein in traditional African cuisine. The plant was thriving in a humid and shaded environment, surrounded by a diverse range of other plant species. Its vibrant green foliage stood out amidst the dense jungle, making for a truly awe-inspiring sight.

specie.description: The native range of this species is Medit. It is a shrub and grows primarily in the temperate biome. It is used as animal food, a medicine and invertebrate food, has environmental uses and social uses and for food.

description: As I was exploring the Tagus mouth Natural Park in Portugal, I was delighted to come across a truly impressive specimen of Salvia rosmarinus. The plant was situated in a lush and humid area, surrounded by a variety of other plant species. It was a large and mature specimen, standing tall and proud, with a sprawling canopy of aromatic leaves that exuded a delightful fragrance. The leaves were long and narrow, with a dark green color and a slightly woody texture.

specie.description: The native range of this species is SW. Angola to NW. & W. Central Namibia. It is a subshrub and grows primarily in the desert or dry shrubland biome.

description: While exploring the arid deserts of Angola, I was amazed to stumble upon a rare specimen of Welwitschia mirabilis. The plant was a true marvel of nature, with only two strap-like leaves that stretched out from the base of the plant and grew up to several meters long. The leaves were tough and leathery, and were believed to be capable of living for up to 2,000 years. The plant had a unique and fascinating appearance, with a short, stout stem that appeared to emerge from the ground.
